contentIssue: Vol. 23, No. 1, Supplement, Papers and Proceedings of the Forty-fifth Annual Meeting of the American Economic Association (Mar., 1933), p. NIL
Abstract: The American Economic Review is a general-interest economics journal. Established in 1911, the AER is among the nation's oldest and most respected scholarly journals in the economics profession and is celebrating over 100 years of publishing. The journal publishes 11 issues containing articles on a broad range of topics.
